node.title: Aussie cricketers to break 24-year Pakistan tour drought in March 2022
node.description: New Zealand and England cancelled tours of Pakistan this year amid security concerns.
node.content: ["Australia will tour Pakistan next year for the first time since 1998, with the visitors playing three tests, three one-day internationals and a Twenty20 match from March to April.", "The announcement is a huge boost for Pakistan cricket after New Zealand and England cancelled tours in September, citing security concerns.", "\"I am delighted to welcome Australia to Pakistan,\" says Pakistan Cricket Board chairman Ramiz Raja. \"From a personal point of view, it pleases me no end that we'll be engaged in a three-test match series, connoisseurs delight.", "\"Australia are one of the high-performing sides and them playing in our backyard for the first time after a gap of 24 years will be a special treat for the fans.\"", "The tests would be part of the World Test Championship, while the ODIs would be linked to the inaugural ICC Men's Cricket World Cup Super League.", "Australia will play tests at Karachi (March 3-7), Rawalpindi (March 12-16) and Lahore (March 21-25), followed by the limited-over matches at Lahore between March 29-April 5.", "The teams will face each other in the T20 World Cup semi-final on Thursday.", "Last time they toured the country, Australia beat Pakistan 1-0 in a three-test series. Pakistan have since played their 'home' tests against Australia in the United Arab Emirates.", "International teams have largely refused to tour Pakistan, since a 2009 attack by Islamist militants on the Sri Lanka team bus in Lahore killed six policemen and two civilians.", "Cricket Australia chief executive Nick Hockley has thanked the PCB for its \"considerable efforts\" in planning for the tour, with the operations, logistics, security and COVID-19 protocols to be worked out over the coming months.", "\"The safety and welfare of our players and staff remains our No.1 priority, and we will continue to work with the PCB and relevant agencies to ensure that appropriate and sufficient arrangements are put in place for the tour,\" he says.", "West Indies will also tour Pakistan in December, playing three T20s and three ODIs.", "Reuters"]
